dialogs.text: I don't know exactly what a prayer is.
I do know how to pay attention, how to fall down into the grass, how to kneel down in the grass.
How to be idle and blessed, how to stroll through the fields, which is what I have been doing all day.
Tell me, what else should I have done?
Doesn’t everything die at last, and too soon?
Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?
The grasshopper jumps onto your shoulder...
Why don’t you go out and discover it?
**SHOCKED**
I see that you are having trouble with finding a purpose in life.
I may not be the one you were praying to, but I am, what people would call me, the AUTHOR.
Do not be alarmed as I am speaking to you in a form of a grasshopper.
And I am going to send you on a journey of discovery, learn well my creation!
Discover your own meaning through the lens of other's experiences.
Mary woke up in a dense, foggy medieval forest, she wonders around while reflecting on her questions about life.
Who—what are you?
Do not be afraid.
You’re... you’re a man?
I was. A knight, once. My name is Bisclavret.
I was a knight, loyal to my king and devoted to my country. But I harbored a secret... I was cursed to become a wolf by night.
That’s awful. Why would she do such a thing?
She desired another man. For a time, I lived as this beast, lost in the wild, until the king discovered me.
Loyalty demands much. But without it, we are nothing.
But is it worth it? If loyalty only leads to betrayal?
There is no easy answer. We must choose what we value most, even when it hurts.
What is this place? It feels... different.
We’re entering the realm of the fae. Be cautious.
Ah, travelers. What brings a knight-wolf and a mortal into my realm?
I... I didn’t know this place existed.
You remind me of myself when I was young, full of wonder and longing.
I... I’m looking for answers. About life, about purpose.
Stay a while, and perhaps you’ll find what you seek.
Well, well, what do we have here?
My lord, I have news! Titania has made a new friend—a mortal, no less!
Titania has gone too far this time.
Go now, and return with the wings of the Dream Butterfly.
There’s more to life than simply finding answers, dear Mary. Sometimes, the magic lies in the questions we never stop asking.
I’ve never thought of it that way.
We should move on, Mary. The fae realm is full of tricks.
Stay as long as you like, child. There is much you can learn here. But be wary of those who wish to twist dreams into chains.
